name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family of 2 adults and 2 children stayed here and we were very impressed! This hotel is unusual as the window of the room opens in to the glass atrium of the reception area instead of outside. This did make the room slightly dark and needed lights on all the time.
reviews.title: Stay at the unusual!

likes.disliked: — Lack of natural light and not being able to see outside of the hotel e.g. look at the weather or have fresh air.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is of a high standard of cleanliness and the rooms are well equipped. We stayed in an executive room for 4 people. The main bed was very large and comfortable, the sofa was a pull out bed for children. If children stay and use this bed make it clear when arriving what extra charges there are for this - we were charged 50 euros extra per night that we didnt realise. The manager did waver this charge after we explained that it did not state this in the beginning.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The breakfast is of a high standard of cooked foods, fruits, pastries, cold meats , cheeses, cereals, something for everyone and the staff were fantastic there especially with children.
reviews.title: Perfect Room and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Its a beautiful hotel in a good location it is away from the crowds of Dam Square but it is in walking distance of everywhere. We took a taxi from Central Station when we arrived and it cost 24 euros but you can easily walk it!! For its uniqueness and its high standard in everything I would definately stay there again - well worth it.
reviews.title: Fab Location - Great Rooms

likes.disliked: — price of optional breakfast - we said no

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed there with my boyfriend and we were both more or less satisfied.
reviews.title: TOP NOTCH

likes.disliked: — Price for parking 45 euro per day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007
reviews.text: This is the third time I have stayed at the Radisson. As Ususal service was very courteous and efficient. The reception area appears to be situated in an enclosed Amsterdam street, a massive glass covering encloses the central portion. This gives the central focus of the hotel a very spacious feel and affords the visitor a pleasant break from the almost persistant rain. The hotel feels like a safe minuture town, quite a contrast to much of Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Oasis in Amsterdam

likes.liked: — The crows nest in the bar

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: The bar has a crows nest, remember you have to come down again!!!!!

reviews.title: Excellent hotel and the most comfortable mattress!
reviews.text: Bedrooms:- we got a Business suite and an adjoining room, for the 3 Kids. Electric roller blinds are more fun than any gameboy advance. No breakfast was included, we paid the hotel direct.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Good location with pleanty of excellent restaurants a short walk away. Though it was in the University area the behaviour of the students was exemplary.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - service a bit poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From Previous experience, it's always best to upgrade as you won't be disappointed. All hotels in Amsterdam are pricey anyway, you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: A very happy stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Spent a few nights at the end of August. The room was spacious, with big windows (some windows do open) and very cleverly situated amenities such as the coffee pot (there was no Nespresso machine in my room in contrast to what the website describes) and the iron/ironing board. The wifi is free and so is the breakfast (i.e., included in the room price), but in contrast to other breakfast buffets in European hotels, this breakfast is nothing to write home about and the breakfast area is cold and impersonal (the hotel is being renovated so that might change). The gym is small but with a rowing machine (a rarity these days). The staff is engaging but can be busy at times. The price is fairly standard for European chain hotels in the city center. In fact this hotel's location is unbeatable just minutes away from the Dam square, the city hall, the fabulous chocolaterie Puccini, the farmer;s market at the Nieuwmarkt, and the wonderful Blauw an de Waal restaurant. Thus it is also easy to get to from Schiphol using public transportation.
reviews.title: Radisson Blu in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great location, nice reception area and brasserie, but rooms were only pleasant, not 5 * level. Can recommend if you get a good deal...
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would certainly recommend this hotel, not only for the great location but for the fabulous service from the hotel staff. We found the hotel to be very clean and well presented. It was a pleasure to see the hotel staff genuinely enjoying the work and nothing was any bother to them, always ready with a smile and ready to assist if needed. We upgraded to a business class room - well worth it! Will certainly be returning on our next trip to Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 5 days in a business class room in this hotel, that we cannot fault.
reviews.title: Immacuate & stylish, quiet yet convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: The photos on the hotels web page are a true representation of the rooms we had.
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Although we stayed over a year ago, I can still remember this hotel very well. Firstly, it was not the cheapest place to stay in Amsterdam, but since we had such a great stay, we shouldn't complain
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is superb and within walking distance to many major attractions. Whether you want to visit the Museums, wander along a canal, visit the Palace or smoke a large joint then this hotel is in the perfect position.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a quiet location

likes.disliked: — The smoking in the public areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Reception / Restaurant / Housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was very good (Although very busy). The housekeeping is to a very high standard.
reviews.title: Just what we needed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay at the Radisson SAS Amsterdam on another visit to the city.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in a perfect location

likes.liked: — the breakfasts and the quiet, beautifully appointed room and bath

reviews.title: Superb, well worth it.
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights in this hotel. Cannot fault it. Close to all the best attractions. Did not eat in the hotel so I cannot comment on the restaurant. Nice and friendly staff. Had to ask for our room to be cleaned on the second day but this was done as soon as we asked. Its about time the rest of Europe copped on to themselves and banned smoking in restaurants and hotel lobbies for a start. Apart from this Amsterdam is a great place to visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review might be slightly biased by the fact that they upgraded us to a business class room from the superior room we'd paid for, so I couldn't comment on the rooms in the rest of the hotel. The welcome was fine, the service was good and the room clean and modern. We had two evening meals in the restaurant and the only surprising thing was that more people don't eat there - the food is great. After reading the negative reviews here I can only conclude that some people might have been sampling the many substances available in Amsterdam. To the person who complained about it not being convenient for getting from the station with heavy luggage - take a taxi!
reviews.title: Good hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights and it turned out to be great!! After a long flight, we were at the hotel around 9 am, much before check-in time, but the reception staff were very helpful. They suggested we keep our luggage there and go out for a stroll. Around 11 am, the room was ready!!We had reserved the standard room using Club points. We upgraded to a Superior room which is bigger and comes with breakfast included. It seemed a good decision. The room was spotless. There is coffee-maker. Bottled water is complimentary. The room comes equipped with a modern iron and ironing table (with a press for trousers!!)..compact and unique!! Buffet Breakfast was a good spread. Rooms are not very spacious, but considering the size of hotel rooms in Europe hotels, this one can be considered okay. I am not sure how big the standard room is. Ours was a superior room in the new block.
reviews.title: "Fantastic location, well-worth the money spent"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel has two buildings connected by an underground walkway lined with beautiful paintings on either side. We did not use any public transport since most of the tourist areas are at walking distance. Lovely cafes, canals, flower market, dam square, shopping areas are all at walking distance. Cycles are also available in the hotel for hire.. All in all, a wonderful place to stay!!
reviews.title: Quality hotel, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel takes up two sides of a small road between two canals.It is in the heart of old Amsterdam amid all of its many charms. Easy walk to Central station so don't be afraid to take the Fyra (high speed train) from airport and just walk to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nicely sized with plenty of room to move around. Plenty of extras. Everything was new and clean and modern. Bathroom was very large with plenty of counter space and a very large, very moderns shower.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and great central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From check-in to check-out everything was just wonderful. We arrived around 10 am on Friday morning and were delighted to be able to check right in and go to our room, freshen up and head into town to see the sights. The front desk was very helpful answering all our questions and provided a great map of the city. You can't ask for a better location. Everything is within walking distance and still a quiet location once you retire in the evening. We had a business room which was quite large compared to other European standards. We will certainly stay there again on our next trip to Amsterdam. It may be a little pricey (conversion from Euro to USD) but well worth it in my opinion knowing you have a clean room, clean bathroom and a bar right downstairs.
reviews.title: Very nice

likes.disliked: — Mini bar and restaurant/bar are expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in a nice quiet street a few hundred yards from the red light district - everything is within easy access.
reviews.title: Perfect location, marvellous rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are staying on a room only basis, charge for breakfast in your room is a whopping 30 euro, not sure how much it is in the restaurant but it will be expensive.
reviews.title: Well located
Great Location. Free Internet.
reviews.text: We have had room service, 2 x burger and chips and a bottle of wine for 60 euro - not a bad price, excellent quality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are staying in the main block of the hotel, room is large and has everything you need - TV, safe, mini bar (mega expensive), tea/coffee making facilities, free wi-fi, trouser press, desk, arm chair etc
reviews.title: Top Notch !!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I visited the Radisson SAS on my own to attend a course in September.
reviews.title: Fantastic location in the heart of Amsterdam
Good choice - great location
reviews.text: Having not been to Amsterdam before, I didnt know what to expect, but the hotel is located really centrally and the main tourist areas are just around the corner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotels rates in my opinion are expensive for the quality of the hotel - it is perfectly pleasant but nothing special - I suppose it is the location that you pay for.
reviews.title: Convenient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is oddly split accross both sides of the street, so if you are staying in the side opposite to the main section, then you do have to go up and down in order to go under the street and then back up in the lift to the rooms.
reviews.title: Wonderful Radisson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an eight day stay. No thing too much for them. Ask and it will be done. Used the restaurant three times, and the bar every night. Both excellent and would suggest you take advice from the bar staff where to go for entertainment and to eat. Rooms are very comfortable. There are cheaper places but if you want a bit of indulgence you will go far to find better.
reviews.title: Good all round.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Just checked out of the Radisson SAS Amsterdam and this was my 5th time staying there. The room iwas adequate enough, we had 2 beds, the hotel is now 100% smoke free which I didn't like.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

likes.liked: — The Location and the free internet
likes.disliked: — Very expensive mini bar items and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008
reviews.text: I had an opening window and me and many others just smoked out the window. Beds comfortable and the beds have just comforters on them, no sheet other than the one covering the mattress we asked them 2 bring 2 sheets each which they did within minutes. good service. Dont touch the minibar otherwise you will be charged in 2 seconds. literally. Bathroom was small and the shower had no PRESSURE. It was the worst shower I have encountered in a hotel in a while.
reviews.title: Great location, very different rooms are on offer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Location is excellent- short walk form virtually everyhting. Clean rooms Ok air-con. breakfast is expensive at 25 euros per person. thats almost $40.00 US. Staff was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — Room key kept losing its code

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Mostly excellent!

likes.disliked: — Noise carries from the atrium reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed at the Radisson SAS Amsterdam for 3 nights over easter 2008. Booked the hotel online via Expedia.de.
reviews.title: great location, friendly staff, nice hotel

likes.liked: — Location, very friendly staff, free internet access in the business center and free Wi-Fi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: First of all, the location of the hotel is perfect, right in the middle of the city, at the edge of famous red light district and at a little canal.
reviews.title: Great for Business, not so much as a tourist even though location is great

likes.liked: — Excellent sevice for the business traveller

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We knew the hotel from passing by at several other visits in amsterdam, so I knew it has a huge atrium lobby with rooms facing into the lobby.
reviews.title: Good location, ok hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008
reviews.text: So I mailed to the hotel, that we would like a non-smoking room with two beds with a window to the street. I assume windows opening to the lobby make the room sticky since you dont get fresh air from the outside.
reviews.title: Good, business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Arriving at the hotel we learned, that they could fulfill all of our wishes and we got a very nice room on 4th floor - 406.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Came back form this hotel last Sunday. I would not rate this hotel as a 5 star. It is a nice hotel and in a quiet location close to plenty of action. We got a deluxe room which was tiny. Excellent hot and cold buffet style breakfast.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We paid €350 for a room for 2 nights which wasn't too bad so no problem with value for money but just don't expect a seruisly luxury 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Excellent Coffee shop across the road!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel is in excellent location not on top of everything . It is located between red light and flower market so easy to see all the sights by walking just make sure you take flat shoes!!
reviews.title: A nice hotel in the city center

likes.liked: — Check in was very quick and room was good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel staff were very helpful and went out of their way to help us. The rooms were clean and tidy and the beds were lovely and soft. Got to say that this hotel was great value for the money and I would go back again.
reviews.title: An interesting hotel...

likes.liked: — Free internet, location to central Amsterdam, Rusland coffeeshop across the street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in January 2008. We were impressed with the standard of cleanliness throughout the premises and the general decor. The integration of old historical buildings into the property is also to be commended. However, in my opinion, it didn't have the "feel" of a 5-star hotel about it. To me, it felt more like your average, run-of-the-mill 4-star that you get in every European city. With this in mind, the cost of staying there seemed excessive, especially when breakfast would have cost €25 per person on top of that.
reviews.title: Radisson SAS, Amsterdam

likes.disliked: — The rate we thought we were paying excluded quite a lot of what I would deem to be essential items

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is excellent. It is close enough to the attractions to be within comfortable walking distance, yet far enough away to be peaceful and quiet. We checked in a few hours early, as our flight from Cork had arrived in the early morning. After a minor fuss from the receptionist, we got our room easily enough.
reviews.title: I LOVE this hotel

likes.liked: — Clean, friendly, close to what I wanted to see.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A minor irritation was to be charged a city tax on top of our rate on departure, which may well have been the fault of the site where we booked the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.liked: — The location, great to be so close to everything, good staff, nice room
likes.disliked: — Bad mood tourist who got angry because I was waiting to use the internet while he was on it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Radisson SAS 6 times in the past 4 years and was never disappointed. The historic bar and lounge are surrounded by an ultra-modern and esthetically-pleasing hotel. Amsterdam requires new properties to be built around historic buildings, so the original tiny hotel (and gorgeous bar) remains in 8 period-authentic rooms. The rest of the rooms are spacious, very clean, modern, and the staff is outstanding. I never stay anywhere else. The hotel is conveniently located to the University, the flower market, and multiple museums. A short walk will take you to the Red Light District, the Hard Rock Cafe, and the Anne Frank Museum. Staff is impeccable. We usually arrive around 6 AM local time, yet are able to check in immediately and take a quick nap before hitting the town.
reviews.title: Nothing was a problem!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: We booked about 5 months earlier but it was worth it because we got a very good deal. I had been looking for hotels in Amsterdam for literally years but had been put off by the expense. The Radisson's prices seemed to be a little cheaper than other 4-5 star hotels in Amsterdam.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: €390 for 2 nights
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is excellent, the staff are lovely, the location is perfect for everything Amsterdam themed putting you in the centre of everything, just make sure you have got yourself a good map for when you have a couple of drinks.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms were well sized and clean, we did not try the food but the bar and setting was lovely.
reviews.title: Business class rooms are great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also this hotel had the biggest bed I have ever stayed in however the sheet was actually smaller than the bed, which I felt was a little odd.
reviews.title: Good hotel with Good staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only down side was the parking, was around €45 per 24 hours and although I understand parking is expensive in Amsterdam some form of concession for guests would be a nice touch... For those who do brave the streets of Amsterdam by car the best place to park is the P1 parking in front of the main station, its €55 per 24 hours on the day however if you pre book online its only €20 per day.
reviews.title: Great location, clean and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Radisson Blu is conveniently located in central Amsterdam. It was converted from several 19th century buildings, and the rooms surround a central atrium. As a result, half the rooms are actually in the interior of the building, and their windows look out on the atrium instead of the city. Rooms are not especially large, but are very comfortable, with larger than average, well illuminated bathrooms. Staff were generally helpful, although I was less than delighted with the attempt to "upsell" us to a more expensive room by the first clerk who greeted us; we arrived three hours before check-in, and were told that although our room was not ready, we could have immediate access to a larger room on the top floor - with breakfast - for an additional 50 Euros per night. No thanks! All in all, an attractive, better than average European hotel.
reviews.title: Convenient hotel in central Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, just 10 minute walk from the station. 10 euro in a taxi. Staff were lovely and very accommodating. Free wifi. Free internet access in reception. Coffee and tea in room. Mini bar was expensive though 4.5 euro for a small bottle of water, 8.5 euro for a small wine. We asked for a quiet room so we were on the 6th floor in the main hotel. Standard room was fine, plenty of room.
reviews.title: Location good, comfy bed, nice room and nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at about 11 o'clock, the room was not quite ready but we left our cases with the receptionist and were supplied with maps and instructions of which places to visit. The area, although very near the Red Light district, was picturesque and peaceful, but be careful, the bicycles sneak up on you. We returned to the hotel at 2 o'clock to be allocated a really pleasant room, with a spacious shower and a large, comfortable bed, giving a very good nights sleep. The food was excellent with a wide choice.
reviews.title: A very good nights sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at this hotel has made our trip. Not only has this hotel got very high standards but its location is perfect. It's close enough to the red light district and tourist attractions to stroll along, and far enough not to disturb sleep at night.
reviews.title: Highly recommend this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was spacious with the most comfortable bed I've been in. Wanted to take it home.
reviews.title: Can't fault it
Radisson SAS Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is on a really pretty tree lined street and close enough to walk to Central Station and Dam Square. The lobby is pleasant, and comfortable with a comp coffee/tea machine. The breakfast buffet is around 21 Euro, but worth treating yourself to...absolutely wonderful! The room was clean and comfortable. The staff were very accommodating. Would definitely consider this hotel when I return to Amsterdam!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson SAS in Amsterdam from 2-4 June. We arrived very early on 2 June, but were able to get early check in. The room was clean and big. We had a view of inside the hotel atrium, which was cool. The room had a minibar (although I would recommend purchasing beer/soda/water outside the hotel as the prices were a little above average), kettle with coffee/tea, iron and ironing board, safe, and the bathroom has shampoos/soap/body wash and a blowdryer. The employees were also very helpful with local information.
reviews.title: Clean and Convenient

likes.liked: — Clean, close to attractions and friendly staff
likes.disliked: — The prices may be a little above average, but still worth it.

reviews.title: Nice Stay at the Radisson SAS
reviews.text: We ate breakfast one morning at the hotel for €35 for two people, but there was a big buffet selection of omelets, eggs, breads, pastries, cheeses, meats and sides, etc. We also ordered room service one night (again, the prices a little above average), but the food was good and the service was pretty quick.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel location was very convenient and in a good, safe area. It was close enough to walk everywhere, we didn't use the tram once, but then again we had excellent weather. It's a few blocks from the Red Light District and Dam Square, but far enough that it wasn't a touristy area. There's also a "coffeehouse" right across the street.
reviews.title: Perfect... Luxury but still very up to date & stylish

likes.liked: — the room was really comfy, up to date and so stylish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found an excellent traditional Dutch restaurant, Claes Claesz, near the Anne Frank House. Much better than the highly recommended D'Vijff Vlieghen and half the price for better food, plus on the weekend they have an excellent piano player. Also, make a visit to the Pancake Bakery!
reviews.title: comfortable and quiet

aka: Radisson Blu Hotel, Amsterdam Hotel Amsterdam
description: Unique Hotel Complex incorporating 17th & 18th-century merchant houses with newer buildings.
